snippet: Borrowing increased $19.3 billion in December after a $20.4 billion gain in November, and the two increases were the biggest monthly gains in a decade.
abstract: Federal Reserve says consumer borrowing increased in December, the second consecutive monthly increase; borrowing rose by $19.3 billion in December after a $20.4 billion gain in November; the increases were the biggest monthly gains in a decade; total consumer borrowing is at a seasonally adjusted $2.5 trillion, nearly matching the level before the recession.
lead_paragraph: Borrowing increased $19.3 billion in December after a $20.4 billion gain in November, and the two increases were the biggest monthly gains in a decade.

headline.seo: Consumer Borrowing Increases for Second Month
